result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Kenneth Lorentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Jail sentence with Huber privileges may be served in Pierce, Pepin, St Croix, Dunn or Polk County and Polk County IOWA at no cost to Pierce County.

Provide DNA Sample.
Guns may be released - .22 to Sheila Lorentz and the remainder of the guns to Tucker Lorentz.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Kenneth Lorentz

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 11:19 Agent Trisha Gilby is in the courtroom.  Defendant Michael Kenneth Lorentz in court with attorney Timothy Joseph O'Brien.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OBrien files an affidavit of Cheryl Lorentz. No objection to that by the state. Froelich - requests Probation 120 cond jail, DNA, Costs, any progams deemed necessary. .22 gun to be returned to Sheila Lorentz and the remaining guns be put in the possession of Tucker Lorentz. Timothy OBrien addresses the sentence. Defendant addresses the court. Judge finds : 14 days jail with huber,  court costs, DNA sample and surcharge,  Guns may be released -  22 to Sheila and the remainder of the guns to Tucker Lorentz.  The jail sentence may be served in Polk County  IOWA   if the defendant  wants to and at no cost to Pierce County.  Jail sentence is stayed until June 7, 2015 at 7:00 PM.  Bond to apply to the costs and the remainder will be returned. Appeal Rights are given to the defendant.
Sentencing Memorandum filed by Atty Tim OBrien
Sentencing hearing at 04-28-2015 11:00 am
Sentencing hearing on 04-28-2015 at 11:00 am
Plea hearing at 04-28-2015 11:00 am
for Continuance filed by Tim OBrien  -  gave to Kerry for rescheduling
Sentencing hearing on February 24, 2015 at 09:15 am.

9:51  pm    JUDGE DUVALL APPEARS BY PHONE 
Defendant Michael Kenneth Lorentz in court VIA TELEPHONE with attorney Timothy Joseph O'Brien VIA TELEPHONE.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire was filed earlier today.  Judge Duvall does colloquy.  OBrien - def will plead No Contest to charge in Information.  Upon acceptance, PSI to be requested.  Return to court after PSI is completed and make sentencing argument.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  Def pleads GUILTY to the charge.  Court has a FAX copy of the plea questionnaire.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Def making decisons knowingly and voluntarily.  Facts support the charge.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty of possession of firearm by a felon.  PSI is ordered.    Def states he has heard everything and does not need to consult with Atty OBrien.  Def consents to plea hearing by telephone.  end:  9:59 pm  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Plea hearing on December 19, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Pre-trial conference on August 26, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Further reading waived.    DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY

4:01 pm  
Defendant Michael Kenneth Lorentz in court with attorney Timothy Joseph O'Brien.  Sean E. Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Andrew Thoms sworn and examined by DA Froelich.  Witness IDs the defendant.  Atty OBrien x-exams Deputy Thoms.    The court finds probable cause that def committed a felony  and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Bond to continue.  Court reads 4 specific conditions of the bond.
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
Def voluntarily waives his time limits for the PH
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
BOND CONDITIONS READ TO THE DEFENDANT BY THE COURT COMMISSIONER
ADDRESS:  5200 NORTH EAST 62ND AVE, ALTOONA, IOWA 50009
DOB:  03-13-1969
PHONE:  CELL: 515-321-1667

4:48 pm 
Defendant Michael Kenneth Lorentz in court, in custody, VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with attorney Timothy J O'Brien in the courtroom.  Sean E Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.
Froelich asks for $1000 cash bond with NO CONTACT conditions as to his ex-wife and their 4 minor children.   Atty OBrien asks for a signature bond without any conditions and gives his reasoning. Def will lose his job if not released.  If there is a no contact condition, it should be only to the exchange of children.   Atty OBrien addresses the Court regarding def's residence in Iowa.  Both RVs are at Sheila's residence.  Def also has a pickup at the residence that pulls the car and a Harley Davidson.  He has someone who can come and get his property.  He at least wants his living quarters and his pickup.  Froelich is not opposed to having a person working with law enforcement pick up the def's property.  Law enforeement needs to be aware of the entire situation.  His oldest son Tucker and his friend Eric Stelter can assist is removing def's property.  DA Froelich will notify the Sheriff's Dept.  The court addresses Sheila Lorentz in the courtroom regarding Michael obtaining his property.  She does not want Eric Stelter or the defendant on the property.  He can take the pickup and the camper now.  She will not harm any of his equipment.  She does not feel safe having him released.  Tim OBrien responds.  She wants law enforcement present when Tucker picks up the vehicles.  NOT A VET.  OBrien will speak to def tomorrow.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
